result.execSummary:
The defendant James W Sage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 5/01/2017 or penalty of 3 days Huber for non-payment.
Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James W Sage

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James W Sage in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Count #1. Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Kershek makes statements. Defendant makes statements. Case #16CM2115 is dismissed and read in to this case. 

The Court Orders the Following to Count #1:

FINE: $442.00 ($250 cash bail posted in Case #16CM2115 to be applied)

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing 5/1/17.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 3 days in Huber.
